result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony David Dean Ehrike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
March 30, 2022
Paige Reardon
Order to release bond
Order to Release Bond

01:06 PM Defendant Anthony David Dean Ehrike in court in custody at Dodge Correctional by zoom video with attorney Robert Thomas Ruth by zoom video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom video.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to count one. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders two years Wisconsin State Prison System, one year Prison with one year Extended Supervision. This sentence is consecutive to Portage County Case 18CF455. DOC to collect costs. Defendant is eligible for programs. Count two is dismissed and read in. Felony rights  given to defendant.
Order for Collection of a Biological Specimen for DNA Analysis at Conviction
